required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Medically Ill VTE Prevention With Extended Duration Betrixaban Study (The APEX Study)
clinical_study.official_title: (Apex) Multicenter, Randomized, Active-Controlled Efficacy And Safety Study Comparing Extended Duration Betrixaban With Standard Of Care Enoxaparin For The Prevention Of Venous Thromboembolism In Acute Medically Ill Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether extended prophylaxis with oral betrixaban can prevent blood clots in the leg and lung that sometime occur in patients hospitalized for an acute medical illness and to compare these results with standard of care enoxaparin. The safety of betrixaban will also be studied.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Cohort 1: Percentage of Participants Experiencing the Composite Event of Symptomatic Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT), Non-fatal Pulmonary Emboli (PE), VTE-related Death, or Asymptomatic Proximal DVT, Through Visit 3
primary_outcome.time_frame: mITT Cohort 1: Between randomization and Day 47 (max)
primary_outcome.description: mITT Cohort 1: Percentage of participants experiencing either symptomatic DVT, non-fatal PE, venous thromboembolism (VTE) related death adjudicated by a blinded independent Clinical Events Committee (CEC) between randomization and on or before Visit 3 or Day 42 if patient did not have a Visit 3, or a blinded ultrasound core laboratory measuring of asymptomatic proximal DVT between randomization and Day 47. Visit 3 is between day 35-42 after randomization (day 1).

primary_outcome.measure: mITT Cohort 2: Percentage of Participants Experiencing the Composite Event of Symptomatic DVT, Non-fatal PE, VTE-related Death, or Asymptomatic Proximal DVT, Through Visit 3
primary_outcome.time_frame: mITT Cohort 2: Between randomization and Day 47 (max)
primary_outcome.description: mITT Cohort 2: Percentage of participants experiencing either symptomatic DVT, non-fatal PE, VTE related death adjudicated by a blinded independent CEC between randomization and on or before Visit 3 or Day 42 if patient did not have a Visit 3, or a blinded ultrasound core laboratory measuring of asymptomatic proximal DVT between randomization and Day 47. Visit 3 is between day 35-42 after randomization (day 1).

primary_outcome.measure: mITT: Percentage of Participants Experiencing the Composite Event of Symptomatic DVT, Non-fatal PE, VTE-related Death, or Asymptomatic Proximal DVT, Through Visit 3
primary_outcome.description: mITT: Percentage of participants experiencing either symptomatic DVT, non-fatal PE, VTE related death adjudicated by a blinded independent CEC between randomization and on or before Visit 3 or Day 42 if patient did not have a Visit 3, or a blinded ultrasound core laboratory measuring of asymptomatic proximal DVT between randomization and Day 47. Visit 3 is between day 35-42 after randomization (day 1).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Major Bleeding Through Seven Days After Discontinuation of All Study Medication
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants experiencing at least one major bleeding adjudicated by a blinded independent CEC between randomization (day 1) and up to seven days after discontinuation of all study medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: mITT Cohort 1: Percentage of Participants Experiencing the Composite Event of Symptomatic DVT, Non-fatal PE, or VTE-related Death, Through Visit 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: mITT Cohort 1: Between randomization and Day 42 (max)
secondary_outcome.description: mITT Cohort 1: Percentage of participants experiencing either symptomatic DVT, non-fatal PE, or VTE related death adjudicated by a blinded independent CEC between randomization and on or before Visit 3 or Day 42 if patient did not have a Visit 3. Visit 3 is between day 35-42 after randomization (day 1).

secondary_outcome.measure: mITT Cohort 2: Percentage of Participants Experiencing the Composite Event of Symptomatic DVT, Non-fatal PE, or VTE-related Death, Through Visit 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: mITT Cohort 2: Between randomization and Day 42 (max)
secondary_outcome.description: mITT Cohort 2: Percentage of participants experiencing either symptomatic DVT, non-fatal PE, or VTE related death adjudicated by a blinded independent CEC between randomization and on or before Visit 3 or Day 42 if patient did not have a Visit 3. Visit 3 is between day 35-42 after randomization (day 1).

secondary_outcome.measure: mITT: Percentage of Participants Experiencing the Composite Event of Symptomatic DVT, Non-fatal PE, or VTE-related Death, Through Visit 3
secondary_outcome.description: mITT: Percentage of participants experiencing either symptomatic DVT, non-fatal PE, or VTE related death adjudicated by a blinded independent CEC between randomization and on or before Visit 3 or Day 42 if patient did not have a Visit 3. Visit 3 is between day 35-42 after randomization (day 1).

arm_group.description: Daily oral (PO) betrixaban capsules for 35 to 42 days and subcutaneous (SQ) injections of enoxaparin placebo for 10 ± 4 days
Daily subcutaneous (SQ) injections of enoxaparin for 10 ± 4 days and oral (PO) betrixaban placebo capsules for 35 to 42 days

intervention.description: Betrixaban 80 mg PO once daily (QD) for 35 day + 7 days. Enoxaparin Placebo: Once daily, 6-14 days
Enoxaparin 40 mg subcutaneous (SC) QD for 10 ± 4 days. Betrixaban Placebo: once daily, 35 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- men and non-pregnant, non-breastfeeding women
- anticipated to be severely immobilized for at least 24 hours after randomization
- hospitalized with one of the following
- congestive heart failure
- acute respiratory failure,
- acute infection without septic shock,
- acute rheumatic disorders
- acute ischemic stroke with lower extremity hemiparesis or hemi paralysis
Exclusion Criteria:
- a condition requiring prolonged anticoagulation or anti-platelets
- active bleeding or at high risk of bleeding
- contraindication to anticoagulant therapy
- general conditions in which subjects are not suitable to participate in the study

address.city: São José do Rio Preto- SP

participant_flow.recruitment_details: First patient was enrolled on 3/29/2012 and last patient completed the study on 1/15/2016. Patients meeting the inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria at screening were randomized 1:1 to either the betrixaban or enoxaparin treatment group.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: To maintain the blind, patients either received betrixaban capsules for 35 to 42 days and daily subcutaneous (SQ) injections of enoxaparin placebo for 10 ± 4 days, or received daily SQ injections of enoxaparin for 10 ± 4 days and betrixaban placebo capsules for 35 to 42 days.

group.description: Daily oral (PO) betrixaban capsules for 35 to 42 days and subcutaneous (SQ) injections of enoxaparin placebo for 10 ± 4 days

group.title: Enoxaparin
group.description: Daily subcutaneous (SQ) injections of enoxaparin for 10 ± 4 days and oral (PO) betrixaban placebo capsules for 35 to 42 days

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Adverse event or serious adverse event
Patient did not wish to attend visits
Patient was assessed via phone in person
Patient was early terminated from study
Patient was randomized due to mistake
THE SUBJECT MOVED TO ANOTHER PROVINCE
Withdraw of consent on day of random

outcome.title: Modified Intent-to-Treat (mITT) Cohort 1: Percentage of Participants Experiencing the Composite Event of Symptomatic Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT), Non-fatal Pulmonary Emboli (PE), VTE-related Death, or Asymptomatic Proximal DVT, Through Visit 3

Visit 3 is between day 35-42 after randomization (day 1).
outcome.time_frame: mITT Cohort 1: Between randomization and Day 47 (max)
outcome.population: Cohort 1 (participants with baseline D-dimer ≥ 2 x upper limit normal (ULN) as determined by the local lab) of the mITT population which consisted of all participants who had taken at least one dose of study drug and who had follow-up assessment data on one or more primary or secondary efficacy components.

reported_events.time_frame: From first dose date (including) till the end of study
reported_events.desc: The number of patients at risk by study arm in the Adverse Events Results is based on Safety population, defined as patients who were randomized and received at least one dose of study drug. It leads to 3716 safety subjects in Betrixaban arm and 3716 in Enoxaprin arm which corresponds to the number of patients at risk in Adverse Events Results.
